author: kaykay0403
content: Any idea what happens to the node running parity open ethereum client during gray glacier ?

author: m.kalinin
content: If you continue to run a version of open ethereum that doesn't support gray glacier it will drop out of the network at the fork block. I don't know if there is any work on making open ethereum compliant with gray glacier cc <@&595684226221735986>

author: leolara
content: looking at its github https://github.com/openethereum/parity-ethereum the project is archived and the last commit and release are 2 years old

author: yorickdowne
content:
The parity client is long gone. The Gnosis OpenEthereum client that took over that work has now also been archived and will not receive Gray Glacier changes.
Your choices are to fork and take over maintenance yourself, or to move to a different EL client. I believe both Erigon and Nethermind have OpenEthereum compatible trace methods.
